references: J. H. Conway and N. J. A. Sloane, "Sphere Packings, Lattices and Groups", Springer-Verlag, p. 114.
links: John Cannon, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
S. Ahlgren, The sixth, eighth, ninth and tenth powers of Ramanujan's theta function, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc., 128 (1999), 1333-1338; F_5(q).
G. Nebe and N. J. A. Sloane, Home page for this lattice
formula: Expansion of f(-x)^5 / f(-x^5) + 5 * x * f(-x^5)^5 / f(-x) in powers of x where f() is a Ramanujan theta function. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 29 2011G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (5 t)) = 5^(1/2) (t/i)^2 g(t) where q = exp(2*Pi*i*t) and g() is g.f. for A008444. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 29 2011a(5*n) = A008444(n). a(5*n + 1) = a(5*n + 4) = 0. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 29 2011
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{A = x*O[x]^n}, SeriesCoefficient[QPochhammer[x+A]^5 / QPochhammer[x^5+A] + 5*x*(QPochhammer[x^5+A]^5 / QPochhammer[x+A]), {x, 0, n}]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 80}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 05 2015, adapted from PARI *)
prog: (MAGMA) L:=Lattice("A",4); D:=Dual(L); T1<q> := ThetaSeries(D,60);(PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^5 / eta(x^5 + A) + 5 * x * eta(x^5 + A)^5 / eta(x + A), n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Jan 29 2011 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 24 2006
